1.content:
It was a Saturday morning and I was over at my girlfriend's house. We were talking in her room when she suddenly left to go to the bathroom. Getting bored, I glanced over at her book that was laying on her desk. Picking it up, I skimmed throuh a few pages. I picked a random page and said the "spell" aloud...

Immediantly after saying the last verse, I grew a bit dizzy and I blacked out.

I woke up and looked around my surroundings to see to my horror I was...
1.title: The Book

11.title: 1 inch tall

choices: Carry on walking through the night.
13.content:
A sickening feeling of vertigo, a wiff of burnt ozone and the universe seems to explode. I felt a wrenching in every fibre of my being and everything went black....
I fell into a restless unconsciousness full of what would be half remembered ghosts of dreams.
Time passed; how much, I don't know, but when I awoke, it was dark. I was lying on the ground, but as to where I was I had no idea. Confusion filled my mind. Wherever I was it wasn't Sam's bedroom that was for sure. It was dark, but it felt far larger. I couldn't see any walls through the gloom. The ground was odd. I was actually perched on top of six inch fibrous tufts which covered the ground, and gave slightly under me. They didn't feel natural and I couldn't figure out what the hell they were or where I was for the life of me. There was a breeze but not much.
I remembered the spell. Surely not? I'd always tried to take an interest in Sam's magick, but it just hadn't occured to me that it would amount to anything. No. That was ridiculous. I couldn't possibly have been teleported to some weird otherworld place by magick. Could I?
As my eyes adjusted to the dark I listened. I could here a very distant rumbling, as if from many miles away. It was barely audible at all. And, also from far away, a noise like a kind of 'deep wind', rhythmic and slowly pulsing. I'm sorry, I don't know how else to explain it all.
Through the murk I saw something in the distance . A dark shape, like hill. As I set off, scrambling over the rough surface I called out for Sam, but there was no reply. No signs of life at all.
Soon, I reached the structure. Or hill. Or something. Walking about, it seemed to be roughly shaped like a boot on it's side. It was about twenty to thirty feet tall. It was really just a dark sillouhette to me, so I can't tell you more. At the lowest point a whole surface ringed a cave entrance some thirty feet across.
Perhaps this would make a good place to camp out till dawn?
13.title: Lost

...a soft crevice. We untangled ourselves from each other and wandered around , to examine our newest surroundings. Not to say there was a lot of room, it was pretty cramped. And from what me and Sam found out...we were in a dresser drawer.

"I hate that girl. Why did she have to steal my stuff! She's not even supposed to be in my room, much less touching my things!", growled a ticked-off Sam.

"Look, blaming her is not the way to go right now. We just need to figure out what to do, and go from there.", I told her. I hope she understands.

"I suppose you're right....But...how are we supposed to get out of here...? It's too steep to climb, and I don't have my book." She explained this with a calm expression on her face.

"I'm not sure. But I think we should curl up and get some rest...", I answered, smiling slightly. After all, we got to be together, alone. Not that I wouldn't rather be normal-sized....

Then we grew a bit, until we were about an inch high.

"What...what happened?", I asked, puzzled as to our sudden growth spurts.

"I think it's slowly wearing off a bit. I think we should be fine.", Sam said, smiling now as I had been earlier.

"So in how long? I mean, will we be normal-sized again?", I retorted.

"I can't be sure. But...maybe a week or two..." Sam said this with a bit of uncertainty...

"WHAT?! Wow....I'm really sorry I got you into this, Sam."

"No prob. Just believe me next time, and listen when I say don't touch something?"

"Hey, I don't want THIS happening again...though I kinda like being small...", I admitted.

Sam blushed a light magenta, and looked down slightly, avoiding eye contact.

"I...I liked you being small too. We...could do it again. -But I'll make sure to keep you taller than an inch!", she added, seeing my scared look.

"Anyways..I think it'd be best to go to bed...err...sleep."

info.brief_description: You knew your girlfriend was a Wiccan... But who knew her shrinking spell actually worked?
info.description:
Here's the story: You, 17 year old Jarrad, are at your girlfriend's, 15 year old Sam, house and decide to goof around with a random spell in her book of shadows... What will happen next?

Characters:
Jarrad- You!
Sam- Your Girlfriend
Matt- Sam's Brother
Amy- Sam's Sister
Andy- Amy's Boyfriend
Amanda-Amy's friend

You may add characters if you wish, I will try to update the front should that occur.

Anything goes in this story, just try to keep the girlfriend unaware of the victim... And please try to keep it in first person such as "And I looked around to see..."

Also, since the characters reduction has made him more dense... He might as well be virtually indestructable.
